messages.subject: Great free downloadable book finds
messages.msgSnippet: All, Since I see these haven t been posted yet, I thought I would share. I won t take any of the credit at all, since it was members on the NMB who found them,
messages.messageBody:
All,

Since I see these haven't been posted yet, I thought I would share. I
won't take any of the credit at all, since it was members on the NMB
who found them, but here are the full downloadable versions of 2 very
scarce, worthwhile and usually expensive books:
(There appears to be no copyright on them, and they are free to
download) Choose the pdf versions and save to your pc.

Legends in Japanese Art by Joly
http://www.archive.org/details/legendinjapanese00jolyuoft

Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. Japanese swords guards - Okabe-Kakuya
http://www.archive.org/details/museumoffinearts00okabrich

Enjoy :-)

Brian

messages.subject: Re: NSR - JAPANESE CERAMICS
messages.msgSnippet: I ve just noticed that scrolling right to the bottom reveals other pages with lacquer and metal working amongst other arts and crafts. Barry Thomas. ... From:
messages.messageBody:
I've just noticed that scrolling right to the bottom reveals other pages
with lacquer and metal working amongst other arts and crafts.

Barry Thomas.

----- Original Message -----
From: "Barry Thomas" <warlord@...>
To: <token_kenkyu_kai@...>; <nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com>;
<nihonto@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, December 13, 2007 9:03 AM
Subject: NSR - JAPANESE CERAMICS


Dear All,

Just stumbled on this which may be of more than passing interest to many:
http://www.nihon-kogeikai.com/TEBIKI-E/1.html

Best regards,
Barry Thomas.
